Description: Terracotta figure plaque of a dancing girl. Melian terracotta figure relief. Mould-made and solid with a flat back. Traces of white coating. Fine, light orange to pink-brown fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Published by Gutch, without context. Parallels from mid 5th century BC Melos (Gutch 1898-9, 85, no. 133; Jacobsthal 1931, nos. 133-4, pl.20ff; Higgins 1970, 165, nos. 614, 618; Stilp 2006, 227-37, no. 115-135). Stilp dates this between 480 and 470BC (Stilp 2006, 234, no. 130). Jacobsthal, P. 1931. Die Melischen Reliefs. Berlin. Stilp, F. 2006, Die Jacobsthal Reliefs. Konturierte Tonreliefs aus dem Griechenland der Frühklassik. (RdA Supplement 29), Rome.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 85, no. 133)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.334) (Phase 3)
